sentences.english: God rejects the requests of those who sinfully despise the Savior.
sentences.chinese: 上帝拒絕那些有罪地蔑視救主的人的要求。

sentences.english: He who despises small things seldom grows rich.
sentences.chinese: 蔑視小事物者難成富有者。

sentences.english: Were she to be found in contempt of court, Interpol could be notified.
sentences.chinese: 如果她蔑視法庭，我們將通知國際刑事警察組織。

sentences.english: Behavior marked by a bold defiance of the proprieties and lack of shame .
sentences.chinese: 對禮儀的蔑視和缺乏羞恥的行爲特點。

sentences.english: The that time disregards everything of I, also just understand this is how terrible.
sentences.chinese: 那時蔑視一切的我，也才明白這是多麼可怕。

sentences.english: Underlying his writing is a contempt of the author for his audience.
sentences.chinese: 在其作品的表相下面，含有作者對讀者的蔑視。

sentences.english: Any government- which is impaired to this point- may pay greupon price.
sentences.chinese: 任何政府蔑視這一點都將付出壯大的代價。

sentences.english: The proud man disdained all offers of help.
sentences.chinese: 這驕傲的人蔑視任何幫助。

sentences.english: The body that he, the materialist, had treated so contumeliously took its revenge on him.
sentences.chinese: 這位唯物論者曾極度蔑視肉體，如今肉體對他了報復。

sentences.english: Jealousy is one of the psychology origins of scorning individual moral.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒是蔑視個人的道德的心理根源之一。

sentences.english: Even cosmopolitan liberals are unabashedly disdainful of their southern neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 甚至蒙古世界性的自由主義者也公然蔑視他們的南鄰。

sentences.english: Shall not intentionally expose the student to embarrassment or disparagement.
sentences.chinese: 不準故意使學生受到尷尬或蔑視。

sentences.english: Images of Gadhafi's fiery defiance flashed in the face of ouster.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲暴躁蔑視的圖像，面對罷黜在不斷地閃爍着。

sentences.english: We should spurn at the difficulties but not look down upon them.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該蔑視困難，但絕不應輕視它們。

sentences.english: The death knell of a marriage is contempt.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻結束的標誌是互相蔑視。

definition: to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
